data.title: Skyliners Frankfurt retain Fraport name
data.meta_description: Fraport has renewed its naming rights agreement with the German basketball team Skyliners Frankfurt.
data.text:
Fraport has renewed its naming rights agreement with the German basketball team Skyliners Frankfurt.

The Frankfurt airport operator, which put its name to the Beko Bundesliga outfit in 2011, has completed an early and 'long-term' renewal of its deal. The team will continue to be known as the Fraport Skyliners, while the airport's branding will also appear on players' jerseys and courtside signage at the Ballsporthalle and Fraport will support initiatives such as the club's youth basketball school.

New online offering for Basketball Bundesliga

London’s Euroleague Final Four: the verdict

Financial terms and the exact duration of the partnership were not disclosed.

“We are naturally delighted that Fraport AG is giving a clear commitment to the club through this early contract extension and the common commitment to the Frankfurt-Rhein/Main region,” said Fraport Skyliners managing partner Gunnar Wöbke. “It's no secret that we are currently at a crucial point for future club development.”

Skyliners Frankfurt – Fraport
